Issues.Title: build(bazel): Fix a bug where the aio build artifact didn't include assets
Issues.Body:
@devversion @josephperrott @gregmagolan 

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The aio build target under bazel doesn't produce an artifact containing assets because the generated assets referenced in angular.json can't be found under the exec root. Either I need to add asset entries to angular.json pointing to the output dirs on each platform, or I just run the build target inside the output tree like I did here.

The test and serve targets do not have this issue because the generatednassets in the output tree are copied to the correct relative path in runfiles.

## What is the new behavior?

The build artifact now contains the assets.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: fix(forms): don't prevent default behavior for forms with method="dialog"
Issues.Body:
The forms `submit` event handlers have a `return false` to prevent form submissions from reloading the page, however this also prevents the browser behavior for forms with `method="dialog"`.

These changes add an exception since the `method="dialog"` doesn't refresh the page.

Fixes #47150.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(forms): don't prevent default behavior for forms with method="dialog"" (#47308)

Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

FormControl.removeControl shows type error when TypeScript strictNullChecks is enabled.

```typescript
const group = new FormGroup({"a": new FormControl("test")})
group.removeControl("a")
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hy5qkn?file=tsconfig.json,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

```true
Error in src/app/app.component.ts (14:5)
No overload matches this call.
Overload 1 of 2, '(this: FormGroup<{ [key: string]: AbstractControl<any, any>; }>, name: string, options?: { emitEvent?: boolean | undefined; } | undefined): void', gave the following error.
The 'this' context of type 'FormGroup<{ a: FormControl<string | null>; }>' is not assignable to method's 'this' of type 'FormGroup<{ [key: string]: AbstractControl<any, any>; }>'.
Property '"a"' is missing in type '{ [key: string]: AbstractControl<any, any>; }' but required in type '{ a: FormControl<string | null>; }'.
Overload 2 of 2, '(name: never, options?: { emitEvent?: boolean | undefined; } | undefined): void', gave the following error.
Argument of type 'string' is not assignable to parameter of type 'never'.
```

Issues.Title: refactor(common): drop unnecessary `srcset` sanitization
Issues.Body:
This commit updates runtime and compiler to drop unnecessary `srcset` sanitization. The sanitization was needed previously for old browsers, but all modern browsers can handle `srcset` safely without any additional sanitization.

See prior discussion in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/45182.

Issues.Title: `(keyup.enter)=""` unable to capture Enter event on Android and iOS
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Today, we are suffering by a weird problem specifically on Android mobile devices. When user hit `Enter` key on a text field (`<input type="text">`), the `(keyup.enter)=""` event filtering won't be triggered. After some study, I found [this issue](https://stackoverflow.com/q/36753548/910074) on stackoverflow. I realized the Android will send keyCode with 229 first, then send keyCode 13 after that. That cause `(keyup.enter)=""` won't trigger the event.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-cn3m9s?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
There is no exception. The event simply won't triggered.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.2.1
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 14.2.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.1
@angular-devkit/core            14.2.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.2.1
@angular/cli                    14.2.1
@schematics/angular             14.2.1
rxjs                            7.5.6
typescript                      4.7.4
```


### Anything else?

Please check the following steps to reproduce the problem:

Go to my demo site: https://ng14-keyup-enter-bug.stackblitz.io/

- iOS

    Focus on `keyup.enter` field. Hit `Enter` on the virtual keyboard on iOS device. Nothing will be triggered.

    Focus on `keyup` field. Hit `Enter` on the virtual keyboard on iOS device. Everything goes fine.

- Android

    Focus on `keyup.enter` field. Hit `Enter` on the virtual keyboard on Android device. Nothing will be triggered. In my phone, it will jump to the next field.

    Focus on `keyup` field. Hit `Enter` on the virtual keyboard on Android device. Everything goes fine. I'm using Samsung S9+. But inn some other Android devices, the `keyCode` will be always be `229`.

Stackblitz source code: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng14-keyup-enter-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

GitHub Repo: https://github.com/doggy8088/ng14-keyup-enter-bug
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`(keyup.enter)=""` unable to capture Enter event on Android and iOS" (#47294)

Issues.Body:

common, router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Since version 14.2.0 we are having problems with testing our component library.
Our tests can no longer find the services using configureTestSuit as shown in the example:
```typescript
configureTestSuite(() => {
```

Issues.Title: Additional Observables for `AbstractControl`: `value$`, `dirty$`, `invalid$`, ...
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Hey all, great work on the typed reactive-forms üëè 
Currently, the `AbstractControl` offers `valueChanges` and `statusChanges` as observables that emit whenever the value of the control changes. While this is great for certain use cases, many RxJS use cases require us to consume the control state reactively.

While working with NgRx, RxJS and Angular, we often still need "regular" observables, which automatically replay the latest state, whenever you subscribe to them. Additionally a lot of developers are searching for ways to bind to variables like `dirty`,  `invalid` reactively.

We were previously using the [`ngneat/reactive-forms`](https://github.com/ngneat/reactive-forms) which offered a great developer experience, by providing these additional observables to ease our lives.

I'd be very happy to **contribute a solution** that simply operates on top of the existing `valueChanges` and `statusChanges` to make the API of the `AbstractControl` more accessible.

### Proposed solution

Addition of cold observables, which replay the latest value, whenever they are subscribed to:
- `value$` Similar to `valueChanges` but emits on subscription the latest value.
- `dirty$`:  Mirrors the dirty getter as an observable.
- `pristine$`: Mirrors the pristine getter as an observable.
- `touched$`:  Mirrors the dirty getter as an observable.
- `untouched$`: Mirrors the pristine getter as an observable.
- `enabled$`: Mirrors the enabled getter as an observable.
- `disabled$`: Mirrors the disabled getter as an observable.
- `valid$`:  Mirrors the dirty getter as an observable.
- `invalid$`: Mirrors the pristine getter as an observable.

### Alternatives considered

Every dev can write their own set of helper functions to reactively select attributes from the `AbstractControl`:

[Example App](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-mwxdxl?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts,src%2Findex.html)
```ts
export function selectFormValue<Value, RawValue extends Value>(
  control: AbstractControl<Value, RawValue>
): Observable<Value> {
  return defer(() => control.valueChanges.pipe(startWith(control.value)));
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Additional Observables for `AbstractControl`: `value$`, `dirty$`, `invalid$`, ..." (#47289)

Issues.Title: Reopen #27936 - Resolved data from parent is not available in child resolver
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Original issue: #27936

When there are 2 routes: child and parent, each has a resolved property, the data form the parent resolve is not available in child resolver (still available in ChildComponent though as expected)

[Original Angular v6 repro](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-7xwxls?file=src%2Findex.html)
[Actual Angualr v14 repro](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-4hynrm?file=src/app/app.module.ts)


### Proposed solution

`data` parameter of `route` should follow `paramsInheritanceStrategy`

### Alternatives considered

The resolve data from the parent can still be accessed as
```
class ChildResolver {
  resolve(route) {
    const parentData = route.parent.data;
    // ...
  }
```
but this looks like a hack
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reopen #27936 - Resolved data from parent is not available in child resolver " (#47287)

Issues.Title: Animation skips state transition triggered by RouterOutlet deactivate=>activate
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

animations, router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Not sure if a feature request or a bug.
If you change the value of the property bound to an animation trigger using `activate` and `deactivate` `RouterOutlet`'s outputs, on route navigations where `deactivate` is immediately followed by an `activate` event, the first state change `whatever=>deactivated` gets ignored by animation.
I suppose it's due to the async nature of the trigger. 
In fact turning the outputs property assignments into async makes things work as expected (at least by me).

You can see it in the provided stackblitz

1.  If you let uncommented the sync router-outlet implementation:

-   at first routing you get the correct transition recognized
```
Property changed to: rendered

State transitioned: cleared->rendered
```
- at exiting routing you get correct transition again
```
Property changed to: cleared

State transitioned: rendered->cleared
```
- but at routing between children, when `activate` follows `deactivate`, transitions get ignored, because seen as `rendered=>rendered`, skipping the middle `cleared`
```
Property changed to: cleared

Property changed to: rendered
```
2. Things works as they should (IMHO) if you comment out the sync router-outlet, and use the one leveraging async assignment on outputs:
this is what you get on routing between children
```
Property changed to: cleared

State transitioned: rendered->cleared

Property changed to: rendered

State transitioned: cleared->rendered
```
I find always "lame" having to resort to setTimeout and similar tricks to turn async something that is not, working in a reactive framework.
So I was wondering if those outputs implementation should be reconsidered.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ts-strict-enabled-nudgw7?file=src/app/app.component.html

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Animation skips state transition triggered by RouterOutlet deactivate=>activate" (#47284)

Issues.Title: Delay option ignored in animation function
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

animations

### Is this a regression?

No (at least I don't think it is)

### Description

The [animation](https://angular.io/api/animations/animation) function accepts a `delay` option which should delay the animation, but the option seems to be ignored (there are no errors thrown/displayed, the option simply doesn't produce any effect).

You can see the issue in this [stackblitz reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-mtumzm), there if the `delay` is provided via the [transition](https://angular.io/api/animations/transition) function then the animation works as expected, but it does not when the `delay` is provided via  [animation](https://angular.io/api/animations/animation).

![Peek 2022-08-28 12-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/187072826-df9e6735-4c62-4309-9e8f-3bbe28b3e47c.gif)

Note: The [useAnimation](https://angular.io/api/animations/useAnimation) function seems to present the same exact issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Delay option ignored in animation function" (#47283)

Issues.Title: Locally running a build > all network requests' request URL's are host url
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9 ### Description After updating our angular app from 9 to 14, stepwise, and fixing all the compilation errors, I was finally able to compile and run the app locally with `ng serve`. All network requests are functioning and pointed at the correct endpoints. When I build the app with `npm run build` which is `"node --max_old_space_size=8000 ./node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng build --configuration production --base-href /app/ && npm run post-build"` and serve it locally, it appears that all my network requests request url's are being replaced with the host url. For example, my login endpoint should be `https://requestapi.com/login` but every single api call has a request url as `http://localhost:4000/`. That's it, nothing append to the end of the url or anything. All the network requests work perfectly when I just do `ng serve`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction package.json

Issues.Title: build: update dependency postcss-import to v15
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [postcss-import](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss-import) | dependencies | major | [`14.1.0` -> `15.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss-import/14.1.0/15.0.0) |
| [postcss-import](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss-import) | devDependencies | major | [`14.1.0` -> `15.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss-import/14.1.0/15.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use esbuild-based builder to directly downlevel `for await...of`
Issues.Body:
esbuild 0.15.6 now supports transforming `for await..of` syntax and will now be used instead of babel
when the syntax is found within code that will be bundled. Zone.js requires that all async/await
related code be downleveled to properly hook promise callbacks. esbuild does not yet support
transforming async generators and so babel is still used when async generator syntax is detected
in an input file.
esbuild 0.15.6 also adjusted the `supported` option to imply that all dependent features of a
disabled feature are disabled as well. For the CLI, this allows only needing to specify that
`async-await` is disabled in the esbuild options.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use esbuild-based builder to directly downlevel `for await...of`" (#23827)

Issues.Title: I am using target es5 but ivy is compiles as a esm5 module
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I upgrade my project from angular8 to angular9, when I tried to deploy in production I get this compile error:
**error message: Compiling @angular/core : module as esm5**
How can I change it to disappear compile error? 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111997844/187560832-dc6ee410-6c95-4ea2-a159-77b2a48bd546.png)


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

 tsconfig.json:

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
{
  "compileOnSave": false,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "downlevelIteration": true,
    "importHelpers": true,
    "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
    "baseUrl": "src",
    "sourceMap": true,
    "declaration": false,
    "moduleResolution": "node",
    "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    // "noUnusedLocals": true,
    // "noUnusedParameters": true,
    "target": "es5",
    "typeRoots": [
      "node_modules/@types"
    ],
    "lib": [
      "es2016",
      "dom"
    ],
    "module": "esnext"
  },
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "enableIvy": true,
    "preserveWhitespaces": false
  }
}
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
_                      _                 ____ _     ___ 
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | | 
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | | 
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 9.1.15
Node: 14.17.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.13
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.901.15
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.901.15
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.901.15
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.901.15
@angular-devkit/core               9.1.15
@angular-devkit/schematics         9.1.15
@angular/cdk                       9.2.4
@angular/cli                       9.1.15
@angular/flex-layout               9.0.0-beta.31
@angular/material                  9.2.4
@angular/material-moment-adapter   9.2.4
@ngtools/webpack                   9.1.15
@schematics/angular                9.1.15
@schematics/update                 0.901.15
rxjs                               6.6.7
typescript                         3.8.3
webpack                            4.42.0
```


### Anything else?
First I get this error **'Entry point '@ngx-translate/core' contains deep imports into'** So I do these steps:
1- Upgrade @ngx-translate/core to version 12.1.2
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111997844/187562046-d6f9476a-9a50-4f73-a756-c6840d73144e.png)

2- then add ngcc file in the root project like this:
module.exports = {
  ignorableDeepImportMatchers: [/ol\//],
};
3- change package.json like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/111997844/187562255-35aa0e5d-1638-4153-8fe0-fed22679240f.png)

finally the error for entry points gone but the this error appear:
**error message: Compiling @angular/core : module as esm5**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I am using target es5 but ivy is compiles as a esm5 module" (#23829)

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.15.6`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0156)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.15.5...v0.15.6)

-   Lower `for await` loops ([#​1930](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/1930))

    This release lowers `for await` loops to the equivalent `for` loop containing `await` when esbuild is configured such that `for await` loops are unsupported. This transform still requires at least generator functions to be supported since esbuild's lowering of `await` currently relies on generators. This new transformation is mostly modeled after what the TypeScript compiler does. Here's an example:

    ```js
    async function f() {
      for await (let x of y)
        x()
    }
    ```

    The code above will now become the following code with `--target=es2017` (omitting the code for the `__forAwait` helper function):

    ```js
    async function f() {
      try {
        for (var iter = __forAwait(y), more, temp, error; more = !(temp = await iter.next()).done; more = false) {
          let x = temp.value;
          x();
        }
      } catch (temp) {
        error = [temp];
      } finally {
        try {
          more && (temp = iter.return) && await temp.call(iter);
        } finally {
          if (error)
            throw error[0];
        }
      }
    }
    ```

-   Automatically fix invalid `supported` configurations ([#​2497](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2497))

    The `--target=` setting lets you tell esbuild to target a specific version of one or more JavaScript runtimes such as `chrome80,node14` and esbuild will restrict its output to only those features supported by all targeted JavaScript runtimes. More recently, esbuild introduced the `--supported:` setting that lets you override which features are supported on a per-feature basis. However, this now lets you configure nonsensical things such as `--supported:async-await=false --supported:async-generator=true`. Previously doing this could result in esbuild building successfully but producing invalid output.

    Starting with this release, esbuild will now attempt to automatically fix nonsensical feature override configurations by introducing more overrides until the configuration makes sense. So now the configuration from previous example will be changed such that `async-await=false` implies `async-generator=false`. The full list of implications that were introduced is below:

    -   `async-await=false` implies:
        -   `async-generator=false`
        -   `for-await=false`
        -   `top-level-await=false`

    -   `generator=false` implies:
        -   `async-generator=false`

    -   `object-accessors=false` implies:
        -   `class-private-accessor=false`
        -   `class-private-static-accessor=false`

    -   `class-field=false` implies:
        -   `class-private-field=false`

    -   `class-static-field=false` implies:
        -   `class-private-static-field=false`

    -   `class=false` implies:
        -   `class-field=false`
        -   `class-private-accessor=false`
        -   `class-private-brand-check=false`
        -   `class-private-field=false`
        -   `class-private-method=false`
        -   `class-private-static-accessor=false`
        -   `class-private-static-field=false`
        -   `class-private-static-method=false`
        -   `class-static-blocks=false`
        -   `class-static-field=false`

-   Implement a small minification improvement ([#​2496](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2496))

    Some people write code that contains a label with an immediate break such as `x: break x`. Previously this code was not removed during minification but it will now be removed during minification starting with this release.

-   Fix installing esbuild via Yarn with `enableScripts: false` configured ([#​2457](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/pull/2457))

    If esbuild is installed with Yarn with the `enableScripts: false` setting configured, then Yarn will not "unplug" the `esbuild` package (i.e. it will keep the entire package inside a `.zip` file). This messes with esbuild's library code that extracts the platform-specific binary executable because that code copies the binary executable into the esbuild package directory, and Yarn's `.zip` file system shim doesn't let you write to a directory inside of a `.zip` file. This release fixes this problem by writing to the `node_modules/.cache/esbuild` directory instead in this case. So you should now be able to use esbuild with Yarn when `enableScripts: false` is configured.

    This fix was contributed by [@​jonaskuske](https://togithub.com/jonaskuske).

</details>

Issues.Title: Build not working correctly with CompressionWebpackPlugin and property 'deleteOriginalAssets'
Issues.Body: # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 11 ### Description After updating Angular from version 11 to 14, the build no longer works correctly. The scripts tag (for runtime, polyfills and main) in the index.html are missing. I use the "@angular-builders/custom-webpack" with the Webpack CompressionPlugin. To not have the compressed and uncompressed files in the dist directory, the 'deleteOriginalAssets' property is set to true. If 'deleteOriginalAssets' is set to false, the build is working fine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Set up a new project with angular cli (no routing, css) `ng new repro-app` 3. Add in package.json in "devDependencies": ``` "@angular-builders/custom-webpack":"^14.0.1", "compression-webpack-plugin":"^10.0.0", ``` 5. Add a new file in root directory called 'extra-webpack.config.js' 6. Write this code into 'extra-webpack.config.js': ``` const CompressionPlugin = require("compression-webpack-plugin"); module.exports = { plugins: [ new CompressionPlugin({ deleteOriginalAssets: true, }) ], }; ``` 7. In angular.json change the builder in build to `@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser` 8. Add the option in build: ``` "customWebpackConfig": { "path": "./extra-webpack.config.js" }, ``` 9. Run `npm i` 10. Run `npm run build` 11. In the dist directory you will see the zipped files and the index.html with missing scripts tag. (Running npm run build with deleteOriginalAssets set to false, the index.html is fine). ## üî• Exception or Error The script tags in index.html are missing:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build not working correctly with CompressionWebpackPlugin and property 'deleteOriginalAssets'" (#23817)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/a11y): Observable in HighContrastModeDetector constructor is undefined
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.0.1

### Description

Caused by #25088

[This line](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/cdk/a11y/high-contrast-mode/high-contrast-mode-detector.ts#L57) fails during Karma testing because the `observe` call before it returns `undefined`

Stack trace:
```
    TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'subscribe')
        at new HighContrastModeDetector (node_modules/@angular/cdk/fesm2020/a11y.mjs:2348:40)
        at Object.factory (node_modules/@angular/cdk/fesm2020/a11y.mjs:2406:1)
        at R3Injector.hydrate (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:9258:35)
        at R3Injector.get (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:9146:33)
        at injectInjectorOnly (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:4778:33)
        at Module.…µ…µinject (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:4782:12)
        at Object.useFactory (node_modules/@angular/material/fesm2020/core.mjs:105:1)
        at Object.factory (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:9345:38)
        at R3Injector.hydrate (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:9258:35)
        at R3Injector.get (node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2020/core.mjs:9146:33)
```



### Reproduction

I'm unsure how to completely reproduce, and I'm unable to share the code due to NDA.

### Expected Behavior

HighContrastModeDetector successfully constructs

### Actual Behavior

Constructor fails on only 2 of my components at the line linked above due to the expected Observable<BreakpointObserver> being undefined.

### Environment

- Angular: Fails on 14.0.2, 14.1.3, and 14.2.0-rc.0
- CDK/Material: CDK
- Browser(s): Chrome Headless Karma/Jasmine
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Amazon Linux 2

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport): autosize miscalculates and adds a blank space after scroll list
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When we want to use a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport with autosize feature for extendable list items we are having a blank space after the content. Blank space is not there when there are only a couple of items on the list however when we have a huge list it's possible to have it.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have a list with  <cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport autosize> and map some extendable card items in it.
2. Have a long list and scroll till the end. You will see there is a blank viewport at the end with no context.


### Expected Behavior

No blank area after the content. autosize should stop expanding the viewport height after arriving at the last  list item on the list.

### Actual Behavior

blank area after the content and height changes after every up and down scroll. 

### Environment

- Angular: 13.2.4
- CDK/Material: 13.3.9
- Browser(s): Safari/ Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows/ macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport): autosize miscalculates and adds a blank space after scroll list" (#25555)

Issues.Title: bug(MatVerticalStepper): Can't bind to [animationDuration] in vertical stepper.
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I'm unsure whether this is a bug or documentation error, but there's a whole section on it in the documentation here: https://material.angular.io/components/stepper/overview.  I saw a lot of traffic on the issue on #17130, seems like it was pushed back in march, so I'm not sure why I am having the problem.

I have confirmed that I have ReactiveForms loaded as that seems to be a dependency according to  StackOverflow.  

Error message below:
```
Error: src/app/create-flow/create-flow.component.html:4:49 - error NG8002: Can't bind to 'animationDuration' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-vertical-stepper'.
1. If 'mat-vertical-stepper' is an Angular component and it has 'animationDuration' input, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'mat-vertical-stepper' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.
3. To allow any property add 'NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component.
```

### Reproduction

Copied example from documentation, 
ng serve

### Expected Behavior

Runs as expected.

### Actual Behavior

Issues.Title: bug(mat-tab-group): dynamic height hides overflow-x
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When I use dynamicHeight with the Mat Tab Group component, the defined CSS class also hides the overflow-x

```
.mat-tab-group-dynamic-height .mat-tab-body-content {
	overflow: hidden;
}
```
It is correct on the mat-tab-body tag but missed on div with the mat-tab-body-content class.
```
.mat-tab-group.mat-tab-group-dynamic-height .mat-tab-body.mat-tab-body-active {
	overflow-y: hidden;
}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Set a Mat Tab Group to dynamic height
2. have wide content in the tab


### Expected Behavior

The **overflow-x** should not be hidden because of **dynamic height**

### Actual Behavior

**.mat-tab-group-dynamic-height .mat-tab-body-content** definition in the css sets the **overflow-x** to **hidden** 

### Environment

- Angular: 13.3.0
- CDK/Material: 13.3.0
- Browser(s): Chrome, Safari
- Operating System: Windows, macOS, iOS
